results.title: Pandemonium
results.creator_credit: Haydn Keenan, Tra La La Films, Smart Street Films and KFM Pandemonium
results.brief_description: Haydn Keenan’s “Pandemonium” is a schlock horror movie that aims to displease by entertaining themes of Neo-Nazism, torture, vampirism, incest, sado-masochism, mental illness, necrophilia and bestiality. In the opening sequence Kales Leadingham has escaped from a lunatic asylum. Arriving at a bus stop be relays his travails (in flashback) to a woman seated there. One day at Bondi Beach, Sydney, a woman ‘Dingo Girl’ arrives in search of answers to her past (cue unremitting shots of Dingo Girl’s large breasts, a la Russ Meyer). Shortly after Dingo Girl and Kale enter a warehouse where a bizarre array of subversive types reside. Inhabitants engage in ritualistic Neo-Nazi ceremonies that result in sado-masochistic sex. Amid other activities, a foetus is placed in a blender, Little Adolph has his penis cut off, cloning experiments go awry - whilst numerous musical interludes interrupt the action. Deliberately provocative, and seeking to shock, this film revels in its low-budget amateurism and artlessness. Aesthetically it shares much in common with “Flesh for Frankenstein” and “Rocky Horror Picture Show” but has no hope of achieving the cult status of these enduring films, principally because its relentlessly over-the-top mood and delivery rob it of any impact as comedy or as horror. The unremitting black humour, shoddy sets, trashy costuming, bad taste themes and poor acting, make “Pandemonium” a curio of Australian filmmaking. Cast includes David Argue, Amanda Dole, Esben Storm, Ian Nimmo, Gary Foley, Haydn Keenan, Ignatius Jones, Lex Marinos.

results.title: Operation Blue Whale
results.brief_description: On May 5th 1992 a dead nineteen metre Blue whale was washed ashore on the South Coast of Victoria. This video documents the challenges faced by the Museum of Victoria in retrieving the carcass, and the preparation of the skeleton for permanent exhibition at the Museum. Photography, music and narration by Dr David Smith. Rights held by Dr David Smith.

results.title: Daintree: The Vanishing Rainforest
results.creator_credit: Danae Gunn, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This video is Part 5 in a series of 6 documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. A child returns from the future, a time when forests no longer exist and we see the rainforest and its most unusual inhabitants through her eyes. She grows to love the forest and cannot understand some of the things she sees happening. This is an imaginative and fascinating story which emphasises the delicate balance of nature, and how easily it can be destroyed. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: The Road to Charlie
results.creator_credit: Stuart Barry, Zoran Janjic, Frank Bagnall, Film Australia and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Made for the Australian Department of Health, this animated film is part of the national drug education campaign. It attempts to show the difficulties of being a teenage individual in the world of group pressures and advises its young audience to look closely at the pressures to conform and carefully to assess their value. Written by Anne Brooksbank, animation by Stuart Barry.

results.title: The Water catalogue
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: ‘The Water Catalogue’ explores a set of moods or psychological states as reflected in water. The work is a poetic musing, observing water in various physical states. The soundtrack is non-sync industrial/ambient music that augments the visual images. Specific light conditions and atmospheres punctuate this painterly presentation. The speed of images have been manipulated to present a choreographed approach to objects and landscape. We are bodies of water…

results.title: Suspension
results.brief_description: A meditation on the narcissistic nature of the consumption of advertising images, ‘Suspension’ consists of footage of hundreds of models’ head shots taken from magazines that Discenza has repeatedly re-taped and re-scanned into an endlessly mutating image of cut-and-paste beauty. This hypnotic video artwork literally suspends the viewer in a cycle of visual engagement, an energetic interchange from eye to eye, viewer to model, consumer to consumed.

results.title: Lost book found
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: The result of over five years of Super 8 and 16mm filming on New York City streets, ‘Lost Book Found’ melds documentary and narrative approaches into a complex meditation on city life. The piece revolves around a mysterious notebook filled with obsessive listings of places, objects, and incidents which serve as the key to a hidden city. It is a city on unconsidered geographies and layered artefacts - the relics of low-level capitalism and the debris of countless forgotten narratives. The project stems from the filmmaker’s first job in New York - working as a pushcart vendor on Canal Street. As usual, Cohen shot in hundreds of locations using unobtrusive equipment and generally without any crew. Influenced by the work of Walter Benjamin, Cohen created ‘an archive of undirected shots and sounds, then set out to explore the boundary’ between genres. During the process Cohen said, ‘I found connections between the street vendor, Benjamin’s ‘flaneur’ and my own work as an observer and collector of ephemeral street life’.

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
Most of this film looks at the streets of Melbourne during the 1954 Royal visit of Queen Elizabeth and the decorations that adorn them. It includes parades in the streets of Essendon and the Queens visit to the Essendon Airport. It also includes the children’s performance to the Queen at the MCG.

It shows many buildings and businesses which no longer exist and others with the original signage including the Tivoli building on Swanston Street, Leviathan Swanson Clothes and the Odeon, H.V. McKay Pty Ltd, Showroom in Sunshine and Mitchell farm machinery in Footscray.

Melbourne businesses include Ball and Welch Pty Ltd. Department store, Snows Department store, State Electricity Commission, Foy’s department store, Darrod’s Department store, Treadway’s Department store, Georges Department store, Buckley and Nunn Emporium, Millege Bros Motor Cycles and Myer.

There is a brief scene of 139 Colins Street which at the time housed the Alexander Club which ran between 1917 – 1983. An exclusive club for wealthy women.

Many forms of transport can be seen including cars, trucks, Melbourne trams and the passenger liner, Gothic, seen in the harbour.

Fashion of the 1950s is also seen throughout.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:21:00 – The Queen and Prince Phillip drive passed in a Humber Super Snipe - Mount Alexander Road

00:00:50:00 – Crowd member uses an old periscope box to see the Queen - Mount Alexander Road

00:01:49:00 – Eve Drayton, Lynette and Roncavel at the car

00:01:56:00 – Drayton Refractories adorned for royal visit Market Road

00:02:08:00 – Queen and Prince Phillip drive past in a Daimler Landaulette – Napier Street bridge

00:03:44:00 – Girls playing with tricycle and pram – Fashion

00:03:50:00 – Queen departing Melbourne Aboard a RAF DC3 fighter plane Essendon Airport

00:05:27:00 – Gothic. A passenger ship in Port Melbourne harbour which the Queen arrived on

00:05:54 – Streets of Melbourne adorned with decorations for the Royal Visit

00:06:11:00 – Flinders street Station adorned for Royal visit

00:09:37:00 – MCG children display for the Royal visit

00:12:22:00 – Drayton family (and friends) at Maroondah Dam Reservoir park - Healesville

00:13:22:00 – Albert and Eva Drayton’s wedding day. (13th December 1941) (extreme left Jock Hider - Best man, Connie Hill, Harold and Gladys)

00:14:23:00 –Eva and parents at family house

00:14:37:00 – Drayton Family posing and dancing - Eva’s Mother and Father, Auntie Edith, Mr Drayton, Eddie, Roy, Albert Drayton, Wesley

00:15:11:00 – Drayton family outside the family home

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
This film follows a Drayton family road trip from Ararat, Victoria via South Australia to Western Australia with many sites along the way including historic buildings, trams, trains, and scenic views including the outback.

According to Albert Drayton the purpose of the trip was to test the spark plug insulators that they had made up.

A number of town halls and post offices are shown from places visited including Adelaide, Ararat, Stawell, Coolgardie, Gawler and Perth

Also included in this film is a number of scenes with Aboriginal families in the outback.

This film is the prequel to ‘Albert Drayton Home Movies reel 2’. A scene of the Town Hall in Stawell without the clock tower (built in 1939) together with Reel 2 tells us the film was made between 1935 and 1939.

Included in the film are many modes of transport including trams from Adelaide and Perth, steam trains, a tramway bus, cars and bicycles.

A few scenes with the Drayton family show fashion of the time.

The film also shows a few animals from the Adelaide Zoological gardens.

There a few interesting but unidentifiable structures including a wooden chapel in the Araluen botanical gardens and a wooden machine, WA.

Places visited include Ararat, the Grampians, Adelaide, Gawler, Stawell, Nullarbor station, Coolgardie, Iron knob, Kimba, Hovea, Araluen, Eucla and Perth.

Selected Highlights List:
00:00:12:00 – Sister Rocks, Stawell

00:01:10:00 – Adelaide Oval, Athletic championship event with band and St Peter’s Cathedral in the background

00:01:36:00 – Grants Coffee Palace, Hindley Street Adelaide

00:01:38:00 – Close up of Overland Steam train at the Adelaide Railway station.

00:01:55:00 – Tramways Bus, Adelaide

00:03:26:00 –Albert Drayton shaving with mirror on the front of the car bonnet.

00:04:26:00 – Old playground, swing, sandpit and merry-go-round, Kimba, South Australia

00:05:25:00 – Nullarbor Station, Aboriginal couple and Drayton Family

results.description:
This film follows a Drayton family road trip from Ararat, Victoria via South Australia to Western Australia with many sites along the way including historic buildings, trams, trains, and scenic views including the outback.

According to Albert Drayton the purpose of the trip was to test the spark plug insulators that they had made up.

A number of town halls and post offices are shown from places visited including Adelaide, Ararat, Stawell, Coolgardie, Gawler and Perth

Also included in this film is a number of scenes with Aboriginal families in the outback.

This film is the prequel to ‘Albert Drayton Home Movies reel 2’. A scene of the Town Hall in Stawell without the clock tower (built in 1939) together with Reel 2 tells us the film was made between 1935 and 1939.

Included in the film are many modes of transport including trams from Adelaide and Perth, steam trains, a tramway bus, cars and bicycles.

A few scenes with the Drayton family show fashion of the time.

The film also shows a few animals from the Adelaide Zoological gardens.

There a few interesting but unidentifiable structures including a wooden chapel in the Araluen botanical gardens and a wooden machine, WA.

Places visited include Ararat, the Grampians, Adelaide, Gawler, Stawell, Nullarbor station, Coolgardie, Iron knob, Kimba, Hovea, Araluen, Eucla and Perth.

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the Drayton’s trip to Western Australia with a few scenes with members of the Drayton Family. This follows on from ‘Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 3’

The film includes visits to Perth, Ashendon, Bunbury and Kalgoorlie, with scenic views of those areas.

There are a number of monuments to the Second World War visited shown and trips to dams including the Mundaring Weir Dam and interestingly, the Canning Dam, in Ashendon under construction. Given the dam was completed in 1940 and the scene shows it near completion, this dates the film around the late 1930s.

Many animals are recorded including animals of the Perth zoo and scenes of camels both working and relaxing.

The film includes a visit to the Perth’s King’s Park and Botanical Gardens.

A number of different forms of transport are seen including vintage cars, trucks, horse drawn carriages, bicycles, tandem bikes, a train, a tram and a car pulling a trailer along a stony track.

There is also a number of historical buildings seen including the Grand Central Hostel on Wellington Street, Perth; The Wesley Church, Perth; Hackett Memorial Building, Western Australia University and a number of old shop fronts on a main street which also includes the Crystal Hostel.

The film shows the Kalgoorlie courthouse and memorial to Patrick Hannan who was an Irish gold prospector whose discovery of gold on 17 June 1883 led to the foundation of Kalgoorlie.

Finally, the film depicts fashion of that era which includes a distant shot of an old pram.

Selected Highlights List:
00:00:02:00 – Drayton family on steps of The Chalet Healy café, Araleun

00:00:31:00 – Views of Mundaring Weir Dam

00:01:03:00 – Overland train coming into the Perth railway station with a view of the Grand central hostel (backpackers) on wellington street in the background.

00:02:13:00 – Mr & Mrs Drayton standing in front of the Australian War memorial, Kings park Perth

00:02:47:00 – Sir John Forrest Monument, Kings Park

00:03:54:00 – Canning Dam under construction, Ashendon, WA.

00:04:40:00 – Main street, Bunbury, showing old vintage cars, trucks, horse drawn cart and bicycles alongside many shop fronts.

00:05:00:00 – Albert Drayton and mother standing beside the Bunbury war memorial on Victoria and Stirling streets, Bunbury.

00:06:39:00 – Hackett Memorial buildings - Western Australia University.

00:07:45:00 – Mr Drayton saying farewell to Gilmore.

00:08:03:00 – Two women riding a tandem bike, Northam

00:08:10:00 – Kalgoorlie Court House clock tower and Hannon street showing vintage cars the Kalgoorlie tram

00:10:26:00 – Two boys with vintage bicycles - Ceduna, South Australia
